metadata.title: CVE-2018-6122 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 66.0.3359.139allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
